DataElement.preferredName: Patient Change Therapeutic Procedure Plan Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response indicating whether or not there is a planned change in the patient's therapy meets the criteria for participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Change Therapeutic Procedure Plan Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._To devise, contrive, or form in design._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Change Therapeutic Procedure Plan Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:To devise, contrive, or form in design.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
To devise, contrive, or form in design.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients who are currently undergoing anticancer  should not have any plans to change or adjust their treatment during the intervention period. This includes changing to another therapy or ending therapy entirely.
